data.content:
I've removed the contacts from messenger a million times and yet somehow I inadvertently seen too keep adding them.
I use my phone for work and I don't want all my clients adds to my personal messenger app. 
So now I've removed them (and I'm temporarily happy) I now received regular notifications on the app informing me to add my contacts to messenger. 

That's my biggest issue. There are so many more, including being unable to access message requests, having to renter all my details (and decline the contact sync) every time I log in and out of different profiles. 
The most recent update has included some random snapchat style image messaging that keeps opening up when I scroll through my messages or I am typing - then I lose my message. 
If I log in/out of the Facebook app it doesn't link with messenger so when my partner or a friend wants to access their profiles on my phone or I need to access my work profile I have to log in/out twice. 
Literally the worst app ever and there was nothing wrong with the original format. 
Messenger needs to take some notes from apps like Facebook Pages that log you in/out automatically and are easy to use.
data.title: Stop Syncing My Contacts!

data.content:
The app itself works fine most of the time. But 2 key things I wish they'd get rid of.
1) The annoying black pop up screen and red exclamation mark insisting that I turn on notifications. I don't want to turn them on. Why do you persist is hassling me to do this? No means no. 
2) The 'active now' time stamp. So many people have complained about this. It causes so many issues in relationships and friendships and still Facebook won't remove it. People thinking that you're online when you're not and then thinking that they're being ignored or that you're talking to other men/women late at night when you're actually fast asleep. I've seen it over and over. Why does everyone have to know when we're online? Is there no privacy anymore? It's beyond ridiculous. But hey since when have Facebook actually listened to its users requests?

data.content:
With Messenger's integration of iOS CallKit, I can no longer lock my screen during a Messenger call, as doing so ends the call. Sometimes, when I answer a call and go to my Home Screen a RED active call bar is displayed - I CAN lock my screen at this time. Mostly, however, when I answer a call and go to my Home Screen a GREEN active call bar is displayed - I CANNOT lock my screen at this time. This is totally random. Absolutely ridiculous. This app can barely get any worse in quality. Terrible, terrible app coding.

UPDATE: I can now lock the screen, regardless of active call bar colour, but once locked, pressing the Home or Power buttons does not immediately wake the phone up. There's about a 15-second delay. Also, locking the screen as above with Speaker deactivated STILL ends the call.

Ridiculous.
data.title: Garbage

data.content:
The security problems with this app are widely covered on the web.  If you try to use Facebook on your mobile you are forced to download it if you want to read messages. It's a second rate messaging system that's deeply flawed that you're forced to use. Avoid if at all possible.

*Fresh Update*

This has so many security and privacy flaws that they keep releasing new versions to clear out all the one star reviews. 

You will get a better feel for how this app functions if you click across to read the reviews for all historic releases of the product. 

*Update for latest version*

Believe it or not - this app is getting worse. Pop ups keep harassing you to allow it to send you notifications to your phone. They want access to all your contacts so they can contact them to get them on Messenger. You don't get to say no just one time - if you don't say "Yes" then they ask you every time you log in. Keeps demanding more of your personal info too. How on earth is this an Apple "Editors' Choice"?

data.content: I use this app everyday. Having friends from all over the world, I can stay in touch with them all. It doesn't cost me anything and if I'm in a wifi zone or at home I can take video calls, these usually work very well. Signal is usually good but can get troublesome if I'm on the bus. The group chat ability is lovely as I can talk to several people at once. Sharing videos, photos ect is another great point. Overall I really like messenger and would be a bit lost without it.
